text: The Polish Football Association (PZPN) is the governing body of football in Poland. It was established on December 20, 1919. == History == The Polish Football Association was founded in 1919. It joined FIFA in 1923 and became a member of UEFA in 1954. == Headquarters == The headquarters of PZPN are located at Bitwy Warszawskiej 1920 street 7, Warsaw, Poland. == Governance == The current president of PZPN is Cezary Kulesza. The general secretary is ≈Åukasz Wachowski. == Activities == PZPN organizes the Polish national football teams, including the men's and women's teams. It also oversees domestic football competitions, such as the Ekstraklasa (top professional league), the Polish Cup, and lower leagues. == References == == Other websites == * Official website of the Polish Football Association * Poland at FIFA site * Poland at UEFA site Category:1919 establishments in Europe Category:1910s establishments in Poland Category:Football in Poland Category:Sports organizations of Poland Category:Association football governing bodies in Europe Category:Organizations based in Warsaw
title: Polish Football Association
